ratings.comment: Professor Gerald is a very amazing lecturer! He explains everything very clearly. As a cs beginner, I won't say I'm talented in it. However, his explanations make everything much easier to understand. He is also very caring and willing to answer all kinds of concerns you have. He keeps track of the class according to students' feedback. Recommend!

Professor Gerald is a really awesome professor. He lectured class very clearly and the exam was what he taught on class. Also, he collected the feedback about the lecture, project, and test to best improve the class. As long as you listened to class carefully, you won't lag behind. He is really patient if you have any question about the concept.

Gerald is a really nice guy who seems like he would be a solid professor at any other level. However, I feel he blows through material far too quickly for a data programming course for those with ZERO-to-little experience. The projects for this class are OUTRAGEOUSLY hard, even when I have a CS major helping me out. Wouldn't take if not required.

He is just AWESOME!!! One of the best professor I have ever had! He explained everything so clearly that you don't even need to try hard to remember it! It's just there! It's like printed in your head! I wish he'll teach more course. Everyone who is looking at this, take his course, please, I beg you.

As someone who has never written a line of code in their life, I was scared coming into CS302. Admittedly, the class was difficult but mostly just time-consuming. Thank God for Gerald, he structured the course in a way that prioritized understanding and learning the material above everything else. Homework, projects, and exams are fair. Recommend!
Have taken 354 and 368 with him, really great instructor in CS. He cares about you.

Gerald is the best CS professor I've had, he's the only reason that I decided my CS major. He is extremely passionate about the subject and inspires that passion in his students. He is also a great lecturer and teaches CS in an amazing way.
He takes suggestions seriously, and so you should make an effort to get your opinions heard. He'll take them into consideration.

He is one of the best professors at UW-Madison CS department. He has reorganized the syllabus for the course to make it look more interactive and easy to follow. Lectures are very clear, and make use of his office hours, pretty chill and extremely helpful. Totally worth taking class with him. Wish more professors like him in CS department.

Gerald is the gold standard of professors. He has perfected everything about what it takes to be an effective instructor: extremely clear lectures, very detailed/efficient slides/presentations, inhuman knowledge of the subject, organized (his classes have the most organized websites you will ever use), and VERY PASSIONATE. Take a class with him.

Gerald is a stellar instructor! He is extremely dedicated to teaching and truly cares whether or not his students understand the material. He has amazing PowerPoints that helped me to visualize tough concepts at a high level. I took 368 this semester just so I could have Gerald again! You won't regret taking his class!
Really amazing professor! Does his best to help. Even puts up notes  from class everyday. Really focuses on everyone!
